subject: Re: [junit] Where is the package org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner?
msgSnippet: Please check the plugins folder of the eclipse. You should download the JDT-SDK file, not just the JDT-runtime file. in the plugins folder, you may see the 3
messageBody:
Please check the plugins folder of the eclipse. You should download the
JDT-SDK file, not just the JDT-runtime file.

in the plugins folder, you may see the 3 jar files. the first part of
the name is "org.eclipse.jdt.junit." . There are "source" in the names.

The source is correctly in the file.
"org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime.source_3.3.0.v20080603-2000.jar" , I
think this can help you

regard
ginkgo

Sam wrote:
>
>
> I'm trying to write a custom JUnit test runner to be used in Eclipse
> (Ganymede). I have some questions about how things are working so I
> downloaded a huge amount of Eclipse and JUnit sources. I've found a
> lot of stuff, but I cannot find the classes that are in the package
> org.eclipse. jdt.internal. unit.runner (e.g., ITestIdentifier,
> RemoteTestRunner) .
>
> Does anyone know what Eclipse .jar file these sources are in?
>
> -Sam
>
>
